decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:Drawing No: 2024 OS 100042766 (Site Location Plan) Dated 29-August 2024 
Drawing No: 283_ 32 _01 (Proposed Site Plan) Dated 29-August 2024  
Drawing No: 283_32_00 (Proposed Site Location and Block Plan) Dated 29-August 2024  
 Drawing No:283_32_ 20 (Proposed Solar Panel PV Location (Section 20) Dated 29-August 2024    
Drawing No: 283_32_30 (Proposed Front Elevation Plan) Dated 29 August 2024
Drawing No: 283_32_ 31(Proposed ASHP Location (Rear Elevation Plan) Dated 29 August   2024
Drawing No: 283_32 _32(Proposed East Elevation 32 Plan) Dated 29 August   2024
Drawing No: 283_32 _33(Proposed West Elevation 33 Plan) Dated 29 August   2024 
DESIGN AND ACCESS STATEMENT-  DATED 15th August 2024
CSG Acoustics Ltd External Plant Noise Assessment Report Dated 15 August 2024 

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 4 - Noise Levels - Expressed as the equivalent continuous sound level) LAeq (15 minutes),Due to potential impact on the surrounding locality from the development the noise criteria recommendations  to protect noise impact on the noise sensitive properties as specified in the CSG Acoustics, Planning Report, dated 15 August 2024 Report reference: CSGA-2200-T1 shall be implemented and maintained as a minimum standard  at the boundary with any residential property. 

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of adjacent properties and to comply with the following Development Plan Policies for Merton: Policy 7.6 of the London Plan 2021, Policy CS14 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and Policies DM D2, DM D3 & DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
  ii) The application was approved without delay.
description: APPLICATION FOR THE INSTALLATION OF 2 X AIR SOURCE HEAT TO THE FRONT GARDEN, 1 X AC CONDENSING UNIT TO THE FRONT GARDEN AND SOLAR PANELS TO THE GROUND FLOOR REAR EXTENSION FLAT ROOF.
